DOC.brief_summary: The purose of this research study is to determine the potential benefit of D-ribose, a nutritional supplement (a sugar), versus a placebo (another sugar) in people with fibromyalgia.
DOC.brief_title: The Role of Ribose in Patients Diagnosed With Fibromyalgia
DOC.detailed_description: Two hundred to three hundred subjects (equally distribued between placebo and D-ribose) between 18-78 years of age will comprise this study. The final numbers enrolled will depend upon obtaining approximately 100 subjects that can display a high degree of compliance to TID dosing with approximately equal balance between the active and placebo arms.
DOC.criteria: previous diagnosis of fibromomyalgia by a MD Has been diagnosed with fibromyalgia and are over 18 years of age Does live in the United States does NOT have severe medication/chemical/supplement sensitivities does NOT have insulin dependent diabetes or other severe illnesses (cancer, hepatitis, congestive heart failure) does NOT have rheumatoid arthritis or gout previous use of ribose
